sentences.en: Diplomats can be a notoriously unreliable and misleading source of information.
sentences.cn: 外交官可能会提供一些靠不住的误导性信息，这是众所周知的。

sentences.en: It is misleading to refer to the principle as an " energy theorem ".
sentences.cn: 将功的定理称为 “ 能量定理 ” 是会使人误解的.

sentences.en: It sometimes becomes that these accounts are misleading.
sentences.cn: 这些说法有时令人误解。

sentences.en: It would be misleading to say that we were friends.
sentences.cn: 说我们是朋友会让别人产生误解。

sentences.en: It'sometimes becomes that these accounts are misleading.
sentences.cn: 这些说法有时令人误解.

sentences.en: Judging by appearances can be misleading.
sentences.cn: 凭外表下判断是会误事的.

sentences.en: Misleading advertisements are prohibited by law.
sentences.cn: 骗人的广告为法律所禁止.

sentences.en: She was accused of deliberately misleading Parliament.
sentences.cn: 她被指控故意误道议会.

sentences.en: Some of the information was dangerously misleading.
sentences.cn: 有些信息有误导成分,会带来风险.

sentences.en: The article contains several misleading statements.
sentences.cn: 这篇文章有几处误导性说法。

sentences.en: The article was misleading, and the newspaper has apologized.
sentences.cn: 那篇文章具有误导性，那家报纸已致歉。
这些数字是在有意误导。

sentences.en: The instructions were not just confusing, they were positively misleading.
sentences.cn: 这些指示不单令人迷惑，而且肯定会误导人。

sentences.en: The very word'war ', therefore, has become misleading.
sentences.cn: 因此, “战争 ” 一词已名不符实.

sentences.en: Their incautious use can lead to wholly misleading results.
sentences.cn: 他们轻易的应用将会得到错误的结论.

sentences.en: We know them as inaccurate and misleading property descriptions.
sentences.cn: 我们认为对性状的这些描述是不准确的，且会使人产生误解。

words.tran_cn: 错误引导者；错误领导人

trans.tran_cn: 误导性的，骗人的，引入歧途的
trans.tran_en: likely to make someone believe something that is not true
